Graph¶

NumpyGraph Class¶

class graph2tensor.client.NumpyGraph¶

An object for graph data manipulating.

lookup_edges(edges, **kwargs)¶

Lookup all the attributes of the given edges.

Parameters

edges – a graph2tensor.common.Edges object, edges to lookup

Returns

a dict whose keys are attributes name and values are attributes value in numpy.ndarray format

lookup_nodes(nodes, **kwargs)¶

Lookup all the attributes of the given nodes.

Parameters

nodes – a graph2tensor.common.Nodes object, nodes to lookup

Returns

a dict whose keys are attributes name and values are attributes value in numpy.ndarray format

add_node(node_type, attrs_info, labeled, **kwargs)¶

Add a new type of node into graph

Parameters

  • node_type – the type of node

  • attrs_info – name & type of attributes of node, dict or list or tuple. For dict, the key should be attribute name and value be type. For list or tuple, each element should be a key-value pair, e.g. (attr_name, attr_type) or [attr_name, attr_type]. In any situation above, the attribute type can be one of int, float or str, and for array, use int[N], float[N] or str[N] in which N is the size of array, otherwise, a ValueError exception will be raised.

  • labeled – whether node is labeled

  • kwargs – other valid args: node_label, the data of node label in np.ndarray format when node is labeled; node_attrs, a dict whose keys are attribute names and values are attribute data in np.ndarray format

add_edge(edge_type, src_type, dst_type, attrs_info, directed=True, **kwargs)¶

Add a new type of edge into graph

Parameters

  • edge_type – the type of edge

  • src_type – the type of source node

  • dst_type – the type of destination node

  • attrs_info – name & type of attributes of edges, dict or list or tuple. For dict, the key should be attribute name and value be type. For list or tuple, each element should be a key-value pair, e.g. (attr_name, attr_type) or [attr_name, attr_type]. In any situation above, the attribute type can only be one of int, float or str, and for array, use int[N], float[N] or str[N] in which N is the size of array, otherwise, a ValueError exception will be raised.

  • directed – whether edge is directed, if not, an reversed edge will also be added, for undirected edge, the src_type and dst_type must be same, i.e., the type of source node and destination node of undirected edge should be same. default to True

  • kwargs – other valid args: src_ids, required, the ids of source nodes in np.ndarray format; dst_ids, required, the ids of destination nodes in np.ndarray format; edge_ids, optional, the ids of edges; edge_probs, the probabilities of edges, when sample neighbours along the edges using “topk” strategy, edge_probs is required and will be used to computed the topk neighbours, for “random” sampling strategy, edge_probs is optional, if specified, neighbours will be sampled based on edge probabilities, otherwise sampled uniformly; edge_attrs, a dict whose keys are attribute names and values are attribute data in np.ndarray format

get_edge_attr_data(edge_type, attr_name, **kwargs)¶

Get the data for attribute attr_name of the edge edge_type

Parameters

  • edge_type – edge type

  • attr_name – attribute name

Returns

the attribute data in np.ndarray format

get_edge_ids(edge_type, **kwargs)¶

Get src_ids, dst_ids and edge_ids of all the edges with specified type.

Parameters

edge_type – edge type

Returns

src_ids, dst_ids and edge_ids, all in np.ndarray format

get_edge_probs(edge_type, **kwargs)¶

Get the edge probabilities of all the edges with specified type.

Parameters

edge_type – edge type

Returns

the edge probabilities in np.ndarray format

get_node_attr_data(node_type, attr_name, **kwargs)¶

Get the data for attribute attr_name of the node node_type.

Parameters

  • node_type – node type

  • attr_name – attribute name

Returns

the attribute data in np.ndarray format

get_node_label(node_type, **kwargs)¶

Get the label of node node_type

Parameters

node_type – node type

Returns

node label in np.ndarray format

to_config()¶

Serialize object into dict.

Returns

a dict which could be used to deserialize

classmethod from_config(config)¶

Deserialize object from dict.

Parameters

config – config in dict format to deserialized from

Returns

an instance of cls class

sample_neighbors(ids, edge_type, num=None, strategy='random', **kwargs)¶

Sample neighbors along with the specified edge according to the specified strategy.

Parameters

  • ids – the id of src nodes

  • edge_type – the type of the edge to sample along with

  • num – the number of neighbors to sample for each node

  • strategy – sampling strategy, several strategies are supported and default as “random”. “random”: sample num neighbors randomly with/without replacement, “all”: sample all neighbors and ignore the num param, “topk”: sample num neighbors with highest edge weights, return all neighbors if not enough.

  • kwargs – other valid args: num_threads, specify the number of working threads; replace, whether the sample is with or without replacement, only valid for “random” sampling strategy; use_edge_probs, whether use edge probabilities as neighbour’s distribution, if not or edge probabilities is not found, uniform distribution will be applied, only valid for “random” sampling strategy.

Returns

A graph2tensor.common.Nodes object for neighbors, an graph2tensor.common.Edges object or None for edges.

random_walk(ids: numpy.ndarray, edge_type: str, walk_length: int, **kwargs)¶

Walk walk_length steps from ids along with edge edge_type randomly.

Parameters

  • ids – the id of nodes to start walk from

  • edge_type – the type of edge to walk along

  • walk_length – the length to walk

  • kwargs – other valid args: use_edge_probs, whether use edge probabilities as neighbour’s distribution, if not or edge probabilities is not found, uniform distribution will be applied; discard_frequent_nodes, whether or not discard frequent nodes; freq_th, the frequency threshold for frequent nodes.

Returns

tuple whose element is list which representing a walk path

node2vec_walk(ids: numpy.ndarray, edge_type: str, walk_length: int, p: float, q: float, **kwargs)¶

Walk walk_length steps from ids along with edge edge_type following the way described in Node2Vec.

Parameters

  • ids – the id of nodes to start walk from

  • edge_type – the type of edge to walk along

  • walk_length – the length to walk

  • p – return parameter, see Node2Vec for more details

  • q – in-out parameter, see Node2Vec for more details

  • kwargs – other valid args: use_edge_probs, whether use edge probabilities as neighbour’s distribution, if not or edge probabilities is not found, uniform distribution will be applied; discard_frequent_nodes, whether or not discard frequent nodes; freq_th, the frequency threshold for frequent nodes.

Returns

tuple whose element is list which representing a walk path

get_dst_type(edge_type: str) → str¶

Get the type of destination node of given edge type.

Parameters

edge_type – edge type

Returns

the type of destination node of given edge type

get_edge_attr_info(edge_type: str) → Dict[str, str]¶

Get the attribute name & type of given edge type.

Parameters

edge_type – edge type

Returns

a dict whose keys are attributes name and values are attributes type

get_node_attr_info(node_type: str) → Dict[str, str]¶

Get the attribute name & type of given node type.

Parameters

node_type – node type

Returns

a dict whose keys are attributes name and values are attributes type

get_src_type(edge_type: str) → str¶

Get the type of source node of given edge type.

Parameters

edge_type – edge type

Returns

the type of source node of given edge type

is_edge_directed(edge_type: str) → bool¶

Check whether the edge is directed.

Parameters

edge_type – edge type

Returns

‘True` if edge is directed else False

is_node_labeled(node_type: str) → bool¶

Check whether the node is labeled.

Parameters

node_type – node type

Returns

True if node is labeled else False

property schema: Dict[str, Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]]¶

Return the schema of graph.

Returns

schema of graph

Example

An example of graph schema

>>> from graph2tensor.client import BaseGraph
>>> import json
>>> graph = BaseGraph()
>>> graph.add_node(
...     "employee",
...     [("name", "str"), ("age", "int"), ("dept", "str"), ("salary", "float")],
...     True)
>>> graph.add_node(
...     "dept",
...     [("num_employee", "int"), ("name", "str")],
...     False)
>>> graph.add_edge(
...     "workmate",
...     "employee",
...     "employee",
...     [],
...     False)
>>> graph.add_edge(
...     "is_header",
...     "employee",
...     "dept",
...     [("since", "str"),],
...     True)
>>> print(json.dumps(graph.schema, indent=4))
{
    "nodes": {
        "employee": {
            "labeled": true,
            "attrs": {
                "name": "str",
                "age": "int",
                "dept": "str",
                "salary": "float"
            }
        },
        "dept": {
            "labeled": false,
            "attrs": {
                "num_employee": "int",
                "name": "str"
            }
        }
    },
    "edges": {
        "workmate": {
            "src_type": "employee",
            "dst_type": "employee",
            "directed": false,
            "attrs": {}
        },
        "is_header": {
            "src_type": "employee",
            "dst_type": "dept",
            "directed": true,
            "attrs": {
                "since": "str"
            }
        }
    }
}

DistNumpyGraph Class¶

class graph2tensor.client.distributed.DistNumpyGraph¶

The client for distributed graph data manipulating.

add_node(node_type, attrs_info, labeled, **kwargs)¶

Add a new type of node into graph

Parameters

  • node_type – the type of node

  • attrs_info – name & type of attributes of node, dict or list or tuple. For dict, the key should be attribute name and value be type. For list or tuple, each element should be a key-value pair, e.g. (attr_name, attr_type) or [attr_name, attr_type]. In any situation above, the attribute type can be one of int, float or str, and for array, use int[N], float[N] or str[N] in which N is the size of array, otherwise, a ValueError exception will be raised.

  • labeled – whether node is labeled

  • kwargs – other valid args: target, the target of the rpc server to fetch node attributes, see graph2tensor.client.distributed.DistNumpyAttributeStoreServicer for details

add_edge(edge_type, src_type, dst_type, attrs_info, directed=True, **kwargs)¶

Add a new type of edge into graph

Parameters

  • edge_type – the type of edge

  • src_type – the type of source node

  • dst_type – the type of destination node

  • attrs_info – name & type of attributes of edges, dict or list or tuple. For dict, the key should be attribute name and value be type. For list or tuple, each element should be a key-value pair, e.g. (attr_name, attr_type) or [attr_name, attr_type]. In any situation above, the attribute type can only be one of int, float or str, and for array, use int[N], float[N] or str[N] in which N is the size of array, otherwise, a ValueError exception will be raised.

  • directed – whether edge is directed, if not, an reversed edge will also be added, for undirected edge, the src_type and dst_type must be same, i.e., the type of source node and destination node of undirected edge should be same. default to True

  • kwargs – other valid args: relation_target, required, the target of rpc server to fetch the relation data of edge, see graph2tensor.client.distributed.DistNumpyRelationStoreServicer for details; attribute_target, the target of rpc server to fetch the attributes data of edge, see graph2tensor.client.distributed.DistNumpyAttributeStoreServicer for details

lookup_nodes(nodes, **kwargs)¶

Lookup all the attributes of the given nodes.

Parameters

nodes – a graph2tensor.common.Nodes object, nodes to lookup

Returns

a dict whose keys are attributes name and values are attributes value in numpy.ndarray format

lookup_edges(edges, **kwargs)¶

Lookup all the attributes of the given edges.

Parameters

edges – a graph2tensor.common.Edges object, edges to lookup

Returns

a dict whose keys are attributes name and values are attributes value in numpy.ndarray format

get_node_attr_data(node_type, attr_name, **kwargs)¶

Get the data for attribute attr_name of the node node_type.

Parameters

  • node_type – node type

  • attr_name – attribute name

  • kwargs – other valid args: batch_size, the size of mini-batch, default to 4096

Returns

a generator which yield the attribute data in np.ndarray format

get_node_label(node_type, **kwargs)¶

Get the label of node node_type

Parameters

  • node_type – node type

  • kwargs – other valid args: batch_size, the size of mini-batch, default to 4096

Returns

a generator which yield node label in np.ndarray format

get_edge_attr_data(edge_type, attr_name, **kwargs)¶

Get the data for attribute attr_name of the edge edge_type

Parameters

  • edge_type – edge type

  • attr_name – attribute name

  • kwargs – other valid args: batch_size, the size of mini-batch, default to 4096

Returns

a generator which yield the attribute data in np.ndarray format

get_edge_ids(edge_type, **kwargs)¶

Get src_ids, dst_ids and edge_ids of all the edges with specified type.

Parameters

  • edge_type – edge type

  • kwargs – other valid args: batch_size, the size of mini-batch, default to 4096

Returns

a generator which yield src_ids, dst_ids and edge_ids, all in np.ndarray format

get_edge_probs(edge_type, **kwargs)¶

Get the edge probabilities of all the edges with specified type.

Parameters

  • edge_type – edge type

  • kwargs – other valid args: batch_size, the size of mini-batch, default to 4096

Returns

a generator which yield the edge probabilities in np.ndarray format

sample_neighbors(ids, edge_type, num=None, strategy='random', **kwargs)¶

Sample neighbors along with the specified edge according to the specified strategy.

Parameters

  • ids – the id of src or dst(when reverse is True) nodes

  • edge_type – the type of the edge to sample along with

  • num – the number of neighbors to sample for each node

  • strategy – sampling strategy, several strategies are supported and default as “random”. “random”: sample num neighbors randomly with/without replacement, “all”: sample all neighbors and ignore the num param, “topk”: sample num neighbors with highest edge weights, return all neighbors if not enough.

  • kwargs – other valid args: num_threads, specify the number of working threads; replace, whether the sample is with or without replacement, only valid for “random” sampling strategy;`use_edge_probs`, whether use edge probabilities as neighbour’s distribution, if not or edge probabilities is not found, uniform distribution will be applied, only valid for “random” sampling strategy.

Returns

A graph2tensor.common.Nodes object for neighbors, an graph2tensor.common.Edges object or None for edges.

Serialize object into dict.

Returns

a dict which could be used to deserialize

classmethod from_config(config)¶

Deserialize object from dict.

Parameters

config – config in dict format to deserialized from

random_walk(ids: numpy.ndarray, edge_type: str, walk_length: int, **kwargs)¶

Walk walk_length steps from ids along with edge edge_type randomly.

Parameters

  • ids – the id of nodes to start walk from

  • edge_type – the type of edge to walk along

  • walk_length – the length to walk

  • kwargs – other valid args: use_edge_probs, whether use edge probabilities as neighbour’s distribution, if not or edge probabilities is not found, uniform distribution will be applied; discard_frequent_nodes, whether or not discard frequent nodes; freq_th, the frequency threshold for frequent nodes.

Returns

tuple whose element is list which representing a walk path

node2vec_walk(ids: numpy.ndarray, edge_type: str, walk_length: int, p: float, q: float, **kwargs)¶

Walk walk_length steps from ids along with edge edge_type following the way described in Node2Vec.

Parameters

  • ids – the id of nodes to start walk from

  • edge_type – the type of edge to walk along

  • walk_length – the length to walk

  • p – return parameter, see Node2Vec for more details

  • q – in-out parameter, see Node2Vec for more details

  • kwargs – other valid args: use_edge_probs, whether use edge probabilities as neighbour’s distribution, if not or edge probabilities is not found, uniform distribution will be applied; discard_frequent_nodes, whether or not discard frequent nodes; freq_th, the frequency threshold for frequent nodes.

Returns

tuple whose element is list which representing a walk path

property schema: Dict[str, Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]]¶

Return the schema of graph.

Returns

schema of graph

Example

An example of graph schema

>>> from graph2tensor.client import BaseGraph
>>> import json
>>> graph = BaseGraph()
>>> graph.add_node(
...     "employee",
...     [("name", "str"), ("age", "int"), ("dept", "str"), ("salary", "float")],
...     True)
>>> graph.add_node(
...     "dept",
...     [("num_employee", "int"), ("name", "str")],
...     False)
>>> graph.add_edge(
...     "workmate",
...     "employee",
...     "employee",
...     [],
...     False)
>>> graph.add_edge(
...     "is_header",
...     "employee",
...     "dept",
...     [("since", "str"),],
...     True)
>>> print(json.dumps(graph.schema, indent=4))
{
    "nodes": {
        "employee": {
            "labeled": true,
            "attrs": {
                "name": "str",
                "age": "int",
                "dept": "str",
                "salary": "float"
            }
        },
        "dept": {
            "labeled": false,
            "attrs": {
                "num_employee": "int",
                "name": "str"
            }
        }
    },
    "edges": {
        "workmate": {
            "src_type": "employee",
            "dst_type": "employee",
            "directed": false,
            "attrs": {}
        },
        "is_header": {
            "src_type": "employee",
            "dst_type": "dept",
            "directed": true,
            "attrs": {
                "since": "str"
            }
        }
    }
}

DistNumpyAttributeStoreServicer Class¶

class graph2tensor.client.distributed.DistNumpyAttributeStoreServicer¶

The server for node & edge attributes fetching.

add_attr(attr_name, attr_data)¶

Add a new attribute into node or edge.

Parameters

  • attr_name – attribute name

  • attr_data – attribute data in np.narray format

add_label(labels)¶

Add label into node.

Parameters

labels – labels of node in np.narray format

DistNumpyRelationStoreServicer Class¶

class graph2tensor.client.distributed.DistNumpyRelationStoreServicer(src_ids, dst_ids, edge_ids=None, edge_probs=None, directed=True)¶

The server for edge relation data fetching.

Parameters

  • src_ids – the ids of source nodes in np.ndarray format

  • dst_ids – the ids of destination nodes in np.ndarray format

  • edge_ids – the ids of edges, if not specified, a sequence from 0 to number of edges will be generated as edges ids

  • edge_probs – the probabilities of edges, when sample neighbours along the edges using “topk” strategy, edge_probs is required and will be used to computed the topk neighbours, for “random” sampling strategy, edge_probs is optional, if specified, neighbours will be sampled based on edge probabilities, otherwise sampled uniformly

  • directed – whether edge is directed, if not, an reversed edge will also be added.
